title: Democracy Isn't Dying
summary: Jan. 6 was a riot, not an insurrection, and U.S. institutions held.. The Capitol riot of Jan. 6, 2021, was a national disgrace, but almost more dispiriting is the way America's two warring political tribes have responded. Democrats led by Speaker Nancy Pelosi seem intent on exploiting that day to retain power, while the Donald Trump wing of the GOP insists it was merely a protest march that got a little carried away.

title: About Those 300 Stolen Ballots . . .
summary: This guy wasn't aiming at election fraud, but that's small comfort.. Police in Torrance, Calif., have finished investigating a man who was found passed out in his car last summer with stolen mail, including more than 300 ballots for the recall vote on Gov. Gavin Newsom. The good news: There's no evidence that the man "intended to engage in any type of election fraud."

title: 5G Truce Expected to Avert Many-but Not All-Flight Disruptions
summary: Talks between AT&T, Verizon and government officials went down to the wire as deadline loomed. A truce reached this week in the standoff over new 5G service and aviation safety will forestall serious air travel disruptions, but remains likely to drive some cancellations, delays and diverted flights, aviation industry and government officials said.

title: The Scandal of Chicago's Teachers Union
summary: Arizona shows the way to respond to unions that refuse to teach.. The political scandal of the year so far is unfolding in plain sight in Chicago, where the teachers union has effectively shut down the public schools. Will this finally cause President Biden to speak up for children? Arizona Gov. Doug Ducey is showing the way.

title: Biden's Immigration Self-Sabotage
summary: Judges restore Remain in Mexico, but the President says no thanks.. Chaos at the U.S.-Mexico border is one reason President Biden's job approval has fallen. Yet he and his designated border czar, Vice President Kamala Harris, keep missing opportunities to do something about it.

title: Ghislaine Maxwell Lawyers Request New Trial After Juror Interviews
summary: Prosecutors also call for an inquiry in case of Jeffrey Epstein associate who was convicted of sex trafficking. Lawyers representing convicted sex-trafficker Ghislaine Maxwell asked a federal judge Wednesday to grant the British socialite a new trial after a juror told media outlets that sharing his experiences as a sexual-abuse victim influenced deliberations.

title: Omicron Pushes Wall Street Toward Work-From-Home Future
summary: Banks such as JPMorgan and Goldman, which urged staff to return to the office last year, are starting the new year with many employees at home. As the new year begins, Wall Street bankers find themselves in a familiar spot: working at home.

title: Congress Ducks Blame for the Capitol Riot
summary: Lawmakers ignored their own responsibility for overseeing the police and sergeants-at-arms.. As I watched the events of last Jan. 6 unfold, I understood I was witnessing a national calamity. But for me, it was personal. To someone who served as the Senate's sergeant-at-arms in the 1980s, and before that as a Senate staffer, the images were a punch to the gut. This had been my office, one that had inspired awe and respect.

title: Inflation and the 'Experience Economy'
summary: Government statistics don't account for how much consumers value memories and time well spent.. With inflation at its highest rate since 1982, the topic seems to be on everyone's minds, from policy makers to shoppers. The worry is especially acute as inflation appears to be rising still.

title: Republicans' Jan. 6 Responsibility
summary: The GOP has a duty to condemn the riot and those who refuse to acknowledge it.. We're in an acrimonious period of partisan tribalism and have been for some time. Both parties are guilty of overwrought denunciations of their political opponents. My criticisms are often aimed at Democrats; on the anniversary of Jan. 6, I'm addressing squarely those Republicans who for a year have excused the actions of the rioters who stormed the Capitol, disrupted Congress as it received the Electoral College's results, and violently attempted to overturn the election.

title: Today's Soaring Energy Prices Are Only the Beginning
summary: Current 'net zero' plans will cost many trillions while doing little to slow global warming.. Energy prices are soaring, and it's likely a sign of things to come. The rise can be blamed on a variety of things, including the demand rebound after the lockdowns ended, a drop in renewable electricity output from a lack of wind in Europe during most of 2021, and increasingly costly climate policies. But while the pandemic will end and the wind will blow again, climate policies to achieve "net zero" emissions will keep hiking prices.

title: Stop Calling Jan. 6 an 'Insurrection'
summary: That's a legal term that denotes much more than a sporadically violent riot or disturbance.. The events of Jan. 6, 2021, are misunderstood, and the failure to correct the record could be damaging to both America's future and its justice system. Words have to have meaning, and the continuous mislabeling of the U.S. Capitol breach as an "insurrection" is an example of how a false narrative can gain currency and cause dangerous injustice.

title: Manchin-Adams in 2024?
summary: New York's mayor says he's the party's future. If he succeeds, he just might be that.. And so it came to pass in 2022 that the major political parties in the United States were led by two late septuagenarians. Politico purported over the New Year's weekend that Donald Trump holds "dominion" over the Republicans, while Joe Biden promises he'll be on the Democrats' ticket, health willing, in 2024. But if you can gaze past those two wintry subjects, American politics actually looks interesting again.

title: 'Aquanaut' Review: Depth-Defying Rescue
summary: After 12 boys and their chaperone were trapped in a flooded cave half a mile below ground, only a few people in the world could save them.. On June 23, 2018, 12 boys-members of the Wild Boars soccer team-and an assistant coach wandered into the Tham Luang Nang Non cave in northern Thailand. The boys ranged in age from 11 to 16, the coach was 25. The official monsoon season hadn't begun; if it had, the cave would have been closed. But rain began falling-lots of it-and when the young adventurers tried to turn back, they discovered that they were trapped, with more than half a mile of rock above them and 21/2 miles of flooding cave behind them.

title: Airlines Scrap Over 1,000 Flights for 11th Straight Day
summary: U.S. sees its worst stretch of flight cancellations since the start of the pandemic. Nearly 1,700 U.S. flights were canceled by Wednesday evening, the 11th straight day of more than 1,000 cancellations and the airline industry's worst stretch since the start of the pandemic.

title: Hasbro Taps Wizards of the Coast Division Chief Chris Cocks as CEO
summary: Incoming toy company chief and former Microsoft executive to serve as permanent replacement after Brian Goldner died in October. Hasbro Inc. named Chris Cocks as its chief executive, elevating the head of the toy company's Wizards of the Coast and digital-gaming division to fill the top job following the death of Brian Goldner in October.

title: Garland Says Jan. 6 Instigators Could Face Prosecution Along With Rioters
summary: Attorney general says Capitol attack's perpetrators at any level will be held accountable. WASHINGTON-The Justice Department is open to bringing criminal charges against alleged instigators of the Jan. 6 attack on the U.S. Capitol along with those who stormed the building, Attorney General Merrick Garland said Wednesday in his first extended remarks about the agency's strategy regarding last year's pro-Trump riot.

title: AT&T Shed Media Assets in 2021. Now It Wants Investors.
summary: Telecom giant's stock slump last year shows that investors have yet to buy into management's promise to reinvigorate the company. AT&T Inc. faces a busy year as it tries to complete a divorce with its entertainment business, ease investor concerns about its dividend and show that it can continue to woo new wireless customers.

title: Fed Minutes Point to Possible Rate Increase in March
summary: Officials also are considering an earlier timetable for shrinking their $8.76 trillion bond portfolio. Federal Reserve officials at their meeting last month eyed a faster timetable for raising interest rates this year, potentially as soon as in March, amid greater discomfort with high inflation.

title: Biden Steps Up Vaccine Push as U.S. Cases Surge
summary: U.K. government tries to ride out Omicron wave without further restrictions in England. President Biden stepped up his vaccination push as cases reported in the U.S. rose to new records, saying unvaccinated people would suffer the worst of the Omicron-driven surge in infections.

title: Interest-Rate Worries Batter Stock Market
summary: Nasdaq sinks more than 3%, bond yields rise amid Fed minutes release. Major U.S. stock indexes fell Wednesday as investors worried that the Federal Reserve might respond more aggressively to rising inflation than previously anticipated.

title: Military Bases Housing U.S. Forces Attacked in Syria and Iraq
summary: U.S.-led coalition forces responded with artillery fire in Syria. Rockets and indirect fire struck bases hosting U.S.-led military coalition forces in Iraq and Syria in at least three separate attacks Wednesday, the third day in a row that Iran-aligned paramilitary groups have targeted America and its partners in the Middle East.

title: Grammy Awards Postponed Due to Omicron
summary: Organizers say annual televised show slated for later this month 'simply contains too many risks'. Organizers of the Grammy Awards called off "music's biggest night" scheduled for later this month due to uncertainty around the Omicron variant of Covid-19.

title: Auto Makers Supercharge Move Into Electric Vehicles
summary: GM, Chrysler, Sony unveil future plans as push intensifies toward battery-powered vehicles. General Motors Co. showed off an electric Chevy Silverado. The Chrysler brand is ditching gas engines and going to an all-electric lineup. And Japan's Sony Group Corp. plans to jump into the electric-vehicle fray, creating its own car unit.

title: Salesforce.com Shares, Software Companies Stumble to Start Year
summary: Swings in software companies coincide with broader volatility in technology stocks. Salesforce.com Inc. shares tumbled 8.3% on Wednesday, continuing a recent stretch of losses that have pulled the software giant's stock to the lowest levels in months.

title: The Fed Hasn't Caught Omicron Yet
summary: Stocks sold off sharply on somewhat hawkish Fed minutes from a meeting when the Covid-19 variant was less of a factor. Sometimes objects in the mirror are more distant than they appear.

title: Discovering Roberto Gavaldón's Cinematic Brilliance
summary: A 10-film program of the Mexican director's work at the Academy Museum of Motion Pictures offers an introduction to an underknown talent.

title: 'Aerial Vision' Review: Flights of Fancy
summary: A show at the Wolfsonian offers a unique perspective on the way aviation and skyscrapers changed our view of the world. Miami Beach, Fla.

title: Omicron School Disruptions Stress Already-Frayed Parents-Again
summary: The Covid-19 surge is making life unpredictable, as families worry anew about providing care and instruction for their kids if sent home. For many parents with school-age children, January started out a mess and is likely to get worse.

title: Markets Jingle, but Not All the Way, to a Santa Rally
summary: Stocks usually rise between Christmas and right after New Year's. This year the Nasdaq Composite missed the mark.. Santa Claus came to Wall Street again.

title: Looking to Eat Less Meat? This Winter Salad Recipe Makes a Hearty Meal
summary: Potatoes, apples, fresh herbs and a punchy mustard vinaigrette adds up to a highly satisfying salad. Add a little prosciutto and Parmesan-or don't, and keep it vegan.. AFTER FEEDING GUESTS in her Atlanta restaurants for nearly three decades, chef Anne Quatrano knows their appetites, and the way they shift with the seasons. "In the New Year people are thinking about eating less meat and more vegetables," she said. "This recipe is perfect for that." Just a few thin slices of prosciutto give this warm potato salad a rich flavor and feel. Fresh herbs, tart apple slices, curls of Parmesan and a mustard-shallot vinaigrette round out this comforting meal and give it an invigorating punch.

title: American Households Face Their Worst Fear: 'Ew, What's That Smell?'
summary: There is a growing paranoia that in the pandemic our homes reek of dirty clothes, stinky foods, mildew, pets, trash or worse; 'It's terrifying for people'. Housebound Americans are buying more air fresheners, scented candles and pungent cleaners to overcome one of humanity's deep social fears-that visitors will think their abodes stink to high heaven.

title: Tony Blair's Knighthood Sparks Protest Petition Over Iraq War
summary: An effort to strip the former British prime minister of the honor has garnered more than 700,000 signatures. LONDON-A petition to strip former British Prime Minister Tony Blair of a prestigious honor has garnered more than 700,000 signatures in a show of anger over his role in leading the U.K. to war in Iraq nearly two decades ago.

title: Downpours (Thursday Crossword, January 6)
For Logistics Events, the Show Must Go On
summary: Organizers of big shipping and logistics events say they are taking Covid-19 safety precautions as they kick off 2022 with in-person gatherings. Big logistics-industry conferences are moving ahead with in-person events in the coming weeks even as the Omicron variant rips through the U.S. and snarls domestic and international travel.

title: Warner Boss Doesn't See Omicron Slowing Down Production of Shows
summary: 'This won't be a situation like we saw in 2020,' WarnerMedia CEO Jason Kilar says. WarnerMedia Chief Executive Jason Kilar doesn't expect the fast spread of the Omicron variant of the coronavirus to slow production of television shows and movies in 2022.

title: Are Chicago Students Suffering With or From Teachers Unions?
summary: Windy City labor bosses among lockdown bitter-enders.. Just a couple of years too late, even much of the media class is starting to comprehend how destructive pandemic lockdowns have been, especially for children. But the teachers union in one of America's largest cities remains unwilling to prioritize education during the latest pandemic panic.

title: What to Watch: Around the World in Five Streaming Titles
summary: From 'Around the World in 80 Days' to season 2 of 'All the Creatures Great and Small' here are new series and films to stream this week. New titles and seasons streaming this week take viewers to the barns of the Yorkshire Dales ("All Creatures Great and Small"), a bar on Long Island ("The Tender Bar") and everywhere in between ("Around the World in 80 Days"). Here's where to stream them all:

title: Blinder Can't Explain Away the Inflation Fiasco
summary: He excludes food and energy only when it is convenient.. Alan Blinder writes that inflation "still looks transitory" but admits "that doesn't mean it will be over in a month or two" ("When It Comes to Inflation, I'm Still on Team Transitory," op-ed, Dec. 30). Indeed, it doesn't mean it will be over in a year or two. According to the Summary of Economic Projections released Dec. 15, most Federal Open Market Committee members think inflation should remain above the 2% target through 2024.

title: Covid Booster Shots Are Safe for Teenagers
summary: The FDA proceeded with approval based on the totality of evidence.. Science is never perfect and the recommendations for managing Covid-19 have been based not on irrefutable scientific evidence but interpretation of messy data. I agree with Marty Makary ("The Dangerous Push to Give Boosters to Teens," op-ed, Dec. 22) that sometimes public-health recommendations have been unnecessarily barbarous, but the recommendation for those ages 16 to 17 to receive a vaccine booster does not fall in that category.

title: Striking Graduate Students Are Not 'Workers'
summary: Columbia is right to resist; Ph.D.s are petit bourgeois apprentices.. Jared Sacks (Letters, Jan. 3) seeks to rebut Provost Mary Boyce's assertion of Columbia's generosity toward its Ph.D. students (Letters, Dec. 27). Unfortunately, he undermines his argument when he attempts to turn Columbia's coverage of tuition cost of $55,000 into a self-serving "accounting trick." Surely, this must count as a legitimate cost to the university.

title: Biden Vets the Bureaucracy
summary: This administration moved quickly and relentlessly to purge personnel deemed not favorable to its agenda.. Regarding your editorial "Breaking Norms at the Biden EPA" (Dec. 29): This administration moved quickly and relentlessly to purge personnel deemed not favorable to its agenda. This, combined with the emphasis on executive orders and regulation, is its great accomplishment. President Trump, despite his famous refrain, "You're fired," was not prepared to govern and slow to implement his own doctrine.

title: Media Conformity Is Shaken, Not Stirred
summary: A progressive consensus won't be abandoned because of a little inflation, crime and yesterday's news about Russian collusion.. Your editorial "The Conformity Crackup of 2021" (Dec. 31) describes a few narratives advanced by progressives that collided with reality. It is tempting to celebrate the left's comeuppance, but progressives still pack a powerful punch in deciding which stories to tell and which to suppress.

title: Records Could Shed Light on Canada Schools for Indigenous Children
summary: Resume Subscription. OTTAWA-A trove of documents that could help identify children who died while attending boarding schools for indigenous children in Canada is set to be released after a yearslong battle.

title: With Holmes's Conviction, Venture Capitalists Distance Themselves From Theranos
summary: Resume Subscription. In their case against Elizabeth Holmes, prosecutors convinced the jury that the Theranos Inc. founder's behavior leading the startup before it collapsed went far beyond the acceptable boundaries of Silicon Valley's fake-it-till-you-make-it culture.

title: Natural-Gas Crisis Pushes German Utilities Into Dash for Cash
summary: Energy giant Uniper arranged more than $11 billion in credit lines to weather the biggest surge in gas prices in a generation. European energy companies are racing to secure billions of euros in funds, a sign of the financial strains caused by dramatic moves in natural-gas and power prices this winter.

title: Want Zendaya's Wet-Hair Look? Here's a Step-by-Step Guide
summary: Water is not enough to achieve a slicked-back style. Here, experts share their personal secrets to mastering this celebrity-favorite coif.. SLICKED-BACK hair is sexy by association. "Are you on a beach? Are you just out of the shower ready to welcome a lover?" said London-based hair stylist Anthony Turner, highlighting two of the look's myriad connotations. "Wet hair definitely has a nonchalant sexiness." Recall for a moment one of the greatest (and speediest) movie makeover scenes: Jamie Lee Curtis in 1994's "True Lies." In need of a seductive new look to tackle her secret spy mission, her meek character Helen rips the sleeves off her matronly dress to achieve a tight LBD; swipes on a red lip; and, to complete her racy transformation, tips out the water from a vase of flowers and runs it through her hair until it's slicked back before walking through her target's hotel-room door.

title: These Unusual Homes Are Far From the Standard Four Walls
summary: Resume Subscription. Laura and Chris Hogzett didn't plan on buying a house that looks like a spaceship. They wanted a log cabin.

title: Walmart, Kroger Raise Prices of Covid-19 Test Kits
summary: Retailers' price increases for hard-to-find BinaxNOW rapid tests follow expiration of deal with White House to sell them for $14. Prices are going up for some of the cheapest and most popular at-home Covid-19 test kits in the U.S.

title: Louisiana Governor Posthumously Pardons Homer Plessy of Supreme Court Segregation Case
summary: Black shoemaker was arrested in late 1800s for challenging a Jim Crow-era law; case went to Supreme Court. Louisiana Gov. John Bel Edwards posthumously pardoned Homer Plessy Wednesday, more than 100 years after the Black shoemaker and activist was arrested for refusing to leave a whites-only train car, a move that led to the Supreme Court ruling that upheld segregation laws.

title: Sign Up for WSJ's Six-Week Money Challenge
summary: Most Popular News. I know I'm not the only one who wants to know more about money - and maybe knows a lot about it already! - but struggles to up my game.

title: Boy Scouts Fall Short of Desired Vote on $2.7 Billion Abuse Settlement
summary: In an initial vote tally, the youth group fell short of the 75% support it believes will ease approval of a chapter 11 plan covering roughly 82,200 sex-abuse claims. The Boy Scouts of America fell short of winning the level of support it sought from sex-abuse victims for the nearly $2.7 billion settlement plan that would lift the organization out of bankruptcy, according to a preliminary vote count released Tuesday.

title: China Immortalizes 'Pillar of Shame'
summary: The destruction of a sculpture will serve only to further the cause it stood for.. The People's Republic of China expanded its attacks on Hong Kong's liberties this past fall by menacing a statue at Hong Kong University commemorating the 1989 Tiananmen Square massacre. But all its aggression against the work of art may have done Beijing's authoritarian agenda more harm than good.

title: How to Break the Vicious Unemployment Circle
summary: Limit benefits when jobs are plentiful and make them generous in bad times: Alabama, Florida and North Carolina are already doing it.. The pandemic made clear that most states weren't prepared for an economic crisis. They hadn't saved enough money to support those who were hardest hit or taken steps to drive a stronger recovery once the downturn ended. Nearly two years later, most of the trust funds that pay for state unemployment benefits are insolvent, while nearly four million Americans are still missing from the labor force. States should look to Florida, North Carolina and Alabama, which have solved both problems by linking unemployment benefits to economic conditions.

title: Chrysler Plans All-Electric Lineup by 2028
summary: Storied U.S. brand is latest auto maker to set out ambitious EV targets. Chrysler plans to become an all-electric auto maker by 2028 as parent company Stellantis NV seeks to revive the fortunes of the nearly 100-year-old car brand.

title: GM Reveals Electric Chevy Silverado to Counter Ford
summary: The GM-Ford rivalry enters the EV age with Detroit's two big auto makers on different paths to new battery-powered trucks. General Motors Co. unveiled a new electric Chevrolet Silverado pickup Wednesday, a much-anticipated introduction that comes as buzz is growing for the truck's future rival: Ford Motor Co. 's F-150 Lightning.

title: David Spade Lists Beverly Hills Home for $19.995 Million
summary: The comedian and 'Bachelor in Paradise' guest host is moving to the Hollywood Hills. For roughly two decades, comedian David Spade's home-improvement projects kept pace with his acting credits.

title: Prince Andrew's Legal Woes Present Another Headache for U.K. Royal Family
summary: Allegations that the queen's second son abused a 17-year-old girl loom large over the House of Windsor. LONDON-Prince Andrew has spent the past few years largely airbrushed from the British royal family.

title: The Military's New Challenge: Defeating Cheap Hobbyist Drones
summary: Resume Subscription. The U.S. is racing to combat an ostensibly modest foe: hobbyist drones that cost a few hundred dollars and can be rigged with explosives.

title: What You Should Know About Treating Covid-19
summary: Resume Subscription. The Food and Drug Administration authorized the first antiviral pills to treat Covid-19 from Pfizer Inc . and Merck & Co . and partner Ridgeback Biotherapeutics LP in December. The authorizations came after each drugmaker's pill received a positive recommendation from a panel of experts advising the FDA, and weeks after the emergence of the B.1.1.529 variant, also known as the Omicron variant.

title: One Chef's Seriously Comforting Vegetarian Carbonara and Other Recipes for Sustainable Cooking
summary: With the publication of the new cookbook 'One: Pot, Pan, Planet,' Anna Jones shares her tips for sustainable cooking. The recipes are delicious and happen to be meatless, too.. IT'S BEEN NEARLY eight years since the British food stylist and writer Anna Jones published her first cookbook, "A Modern Way to Eat." Back then, vegetarianism "definitely had some negative and ungenerous connotations," said Ms. Jones recently. "I was very careful. I really wanted people to get excited about the food and then, 40 pages in, realize that there wasn't any meat or fish."

title: Tokyo Game Maker Buys Into Marvel Directors' Production Company
summary: Deal values AGBO, entertainment company co-founded by 'Avengers: Endgame' directors Joe and Anthony Russo, at $1.1 billion. Nexon Co. is taking a minority stake in AGBO, the production company co-founded by "Avengers: Endgame" directors Joe and Anthony Russo, the two sides said Wednesday, giving the game developer a foothold in the rush for Hollywood content companies.

title: Allegiant Air to Buy 50 Boeing 737 MAX Jets
summary: Agreement adds a U.S. customer for Boeing and provides an option for the carrier to buy 50 additional planes. Low-cost carrier Allegiant Air is ordering up to 100 Boeing Co. 737 MAX jetliners, a win for the U.S. aerospace manufacturer that has suffered several setbacks in recent years.

title: How to Fill a Home With Art Without Making It Feel Like a Museum
summary: Resume Subscription. Toronto couple Alan and Alison Schwartz were facing some major transitions as they planned their next home. They were moving out of a series of single-family homes into an apartment for their empty-nester years, and they were rethinking the focus of their extensive art collection. Their challenge was to create a home that was good for their cutting-edge art but comfortable for them. Their strategy? Take it slow, allowing art and décor to merge into a lifestyle.

title: Europe's Trade Czar Walks Line Between U.S. and China
summary: Valdis Dombrovskis, the EU's top economic chief, is trying to lift the economy from Covid-19 crisis and strengthen it against foreign rivals. BRUSSELS-For Europe's top trade and economic official, the past year was largely about undoing damage. Now the agenda shifts to building anew, which promises to be more difficult.

title: Navy Radar Training Launched a Career in Computer Science
summary: Bruce W. Arden, who has died at age 94, made mainframes more accessible and used them to calculate missile trajectories. Bruce W. Arden endured part of his childhood on a farm in Kansas with no indoor plumbing or electricity. At age 17, in 1944, he enlisted in the U.S. Navy and learned the elements of electronics as a radar technician.

title: Top Colleges in the Northeast for Diversity
summary: Rutgers University-Newark tops a list that includes six CUNY schools in the WSJ/THE College Rankings. Rutgers University-Newark ranks highest among schools in the Northeast for the diversity of its students and faculty in the Wall Street Journal/Times Higher Education College Rankings. It is followed by City College of New York, one of six schools in the City University of New York system to rank among the region's top 10 for diversity.

title: Beyond Meat, Sea, Simply Good Foods, GM: What to Watch in the Stock Market Today
summary: Beyond Meat's plant-based chicken will be sold in KFC restaurants; Tencent cut its stake in Sea. Stocks on Wall Street are wavering ahead of the release of minutes from the Federal Reserve's latest policy meeting. Here's what's moving in Wednesday's trading:

title: Internet Conglomerate IAC Hires NFL Executive as CFO
summary: Christopher Halpin will join the company later this month. Internet conglomerate IAC/InterActiveCorp. hired Christopher Halpin, a National Football League executive, as its next finance chief. He succeeds Glenn Schiffman, who resigned last year.

title: Is Looking at Art a Path to Mental Well-Being?
summary: With new research suggesting that viewing art might improve mental health, some doctors are prescribing museum visits. Is art really a shortcut to happiness?. During a dark period in his youth, Bill Murray thought about killing himself while wandering the streets of Chicago. "I was ready to die," the actor said at a press conference several years ago. That day he decided to visit the Art Institute and found himself in front of Jules Breton's 1884 painting The Song of the Lark, which depicts a young woman looking skyward, sickle in hand, a violent orange sunrise behind her. Suddenly, Murray felt hope. "I just thought, Well, there's a girl who doesn't have a whole lot of prospects, but the sun's coming up anyway and she's got another chance at it," he said. "That gave me some sort of feeling that I too am a person, and get another chance every day the sun comes up." Murray credits the painting with saving his life.

title: France's Macron Rails Against Unvaccinated People
summary: Comments come as lawmakers consider tightening France's Covid-19 vaccination rules. PARIS-President Emmanuel Macron set off a wave of criticism from his political opposition Wednesday by using a vulgar term to lash out at people who haven't been vaccinated against Covid-19, framing their refusal to inoculate as a betrayal of French citizenship.

title: North Korea Fires Missile Off Its East Coast
summary: Launch comes days after North Korean leader Kim Jong Un vowed to pursue high-tech weapons. SEOUL-North Korea fired a suspected ballistic missile into waters off its east coast on Wednesday, South Korean and Japanese authorities said, the first such test in the new year.

title: China's Unpredictable, Heavy-Handed Governance Threatens Growth
summary: The country lacks the right policy tools to meet Xi Jinping's vastly expanded goals as centralized power roils decision making. China enters 2022 with a bit less swagger than a year earlier. A roaring economic comeback then has since been tripped up by Covid-19 lockdowns, energy shortages and a cooling property market. Declining births and worsening international relations cloud the longer-term outlook.

title: How to Plan a Last-Minute Getaway? A Few Pointers
summary: Omicron has already wreaked havoc with vacation plans but last-minute travelers can land on bargains. Here, we offer four resources for anyone craving a spontaneous escape.. PLANNING A VACATION well in advance has come to feel like playing a game of roulette. Will some new Covid variant leave a border closed when the wheel finally stops, or make Budapest suddenly look better than Buenos Aires? Travelers have responded by waiting until closer to their hoped-for departure dates to begin strategizing, and staying ready to change plans at a moment's notice.

title: Phone-Bill Fees to Fund Suicide Hotline Spark Statehouse Debates
summary: Telecoms want fees limited to covering costs, not expanding mental-health services. WASHINGTON-Skirmishes are breaking out at statehouses across the U.S. over how to pay for a new suicide hotline.

title: Sports Talent Agency Wasserman Acquires The Montag Group
summary: The Montag Group brand will remain, and founder Sandy Montag will join the combined company. Wasserman, the global sports talent agency founded and led by entertainment and sports executive Casey Wasserman, is acquiring The Montag Group, home of many big name sports broadcasters including Bob Costas, James Brown and Jim Nantz.

title: Retailers' Many Unhappy Returns
summary: Extended return windows and higher parcel costs threaten to cause a margin-eroding headache when shoppers send back holiday gifts. As the holiday glow wears off and consumers return to their normal routines, they will start sobering up to the reality of those ill-fitting pants bought hastily at a holiday sale or that gifted necklace they will probably never wear. They won't be the only ones who are disappointed: Longer return windows and higher parcel costs mean returns could end up taking a bigger bite out of retailers this year.

title: Chinese Internet Stocks Tumble Again After Tencent Divestment
summary: Hang Seng Index ends 1.6% lower as Chinese regulators indicate tech crackdown isn't over. Shares of many Chinese internet companies tumbled again in Hong Kong on Wednesday, after industry giant Tencent Holdings Ltd. sold a $3 billion stake in one of its highflying affiliates and Chinese regulators indicated their long-running crackdown on the sector is far from over.

title: There May Be Life Left in Life-Insurance Stocks
summary: Pattern of Covid-19 fatalities could help life insurers, though share performance may depend more on what happens in broader market. The pandemic's third year might bring declining benefit payouts to life-insurance policyholders. Whether that brings increasing benefits for shareholders depends on more than Covid-19.

title: China's Capital Meets Own Clean-Air Standards for First Time as Olympics Approach
summary: Beijing's concentration of fine particulate matter has fallen 63% from 2013 levels, though it remains almost seven times the WHO-recommended levels. HONG KONG-China's capital, Beijing, met all national air-quality standards for the first time since targets were set in 2013, city officials said, marking a milestone in China's effort to clean up the air-just as thousands prepare to descend on the city for next month's Winter Olympics.

title: Oprah Needs New Year's Resolutions to Stick
summary: WW International, formerly Weight Watchers, is having a tough pandemic and must show signs of a turnaround during a typically prime period for new subscribers. Each new year begins full of hope for this company and its clients, but few were as disappointing as 2021.

title: Hong Kong Bans Flights, Shuts Nightlife Over Omicron Cases
summary: City had seen no Covid-19 cases for months until aircrew mingled in the community in late December. HONG KONG-Hong Kong is banning passenger flights from eight countries, including the U.S., for two weeks, closing bars and banning evening dine-in after the city's first community Omicron infections punctured one of the world's strictest and most effective border controls.

title: Ad-Tech Company Smartly.io to Buy Google-Focused Firm for Over $100 Million
summary: Purchase of Ad-Lib.io will help Smartly.io expand from paid social-media offerings into Google platforms as marketers route more dollars into digital advertising. Advertising technology provider Smartly.io Solutions Oy said it is buying Ad-Lib.io, a company that offers creative tools for various Google platforms, for more than $100 million, as it seeks to widen its offerings beyond social media.

title: Sustainability Efforts Run Through Information Technology
summary: CIOs in a survey said they expect sustainability to be the area where technology has the biggest impact in their organizations in the next three years. Chief information officers have emerged as key players in their companies' sustainability programs, leading efforts to unload power-hungry computer-processing applications to the cloud and roll out tech aimed at energy optimization and waste reduction.

title: China's Anta Gains on Nike, Adidas Over Forced-Labor Issue
summary: Western sportswear brands lose ground in China amid consumer boycott of foreign companies taking stand on Xinjiang cotton. While Western sportswear companies including Adidas AG and Puma SE lose sales in China over a consumer boycott, a homegrown rival is fast gaining ground.

title: Companies Expect Funding to Stay Cheap, Despite Rate Increases
summary: Still, forecast changes to U.S. monetary policy are prompting chief financial officers to refinance debt coming due over the next few years. Many U.S. finance chiefs secured cheap funding for their businesses in 2021 and anticipate similar conditions in 2022, although expected rate increases by the Federal Reserve are prompting companies to refinance some debt coming due over the next few years.

title: China Mobile Makes Debut in Shanghai
summary: Cellphone carrier was booted from the New York Stock Exchange after it was added to U.S. investment blacklist. Eight months after China Mobile Ltd. was booted from the New York Stock Exchange, the giant cellphone carrier made its debut in Shanghai on Wednesday after raising close to $9 billion in a blockbuster homecoming listing.

title: Australia, Japan to Sign Defense Treaty Amid China Tensions
summary: Australia-Japan pact will allow troops to freely enter each other's countries for exercises without having to negotiate terms each time. Japan and Australia plan to sign a treaty on Thursday that will allow their militaries to work more closely together, in the latest example of U.S. allies strengthening ties to counter the rising threat from China.

title: Sony Looks to Sell Its Own Electric Vehicles
summary: PlayStation maker shows off an SUV prototype at CES and plans to create a mobility unit. Sony Group Corp. said it would create a car unit and explore entering the electric-vehicle market, in another sign of how the electronics and car businesses are overlapping.

title: California Finds PG&E Responsible for Dixie Fire
summary: PG&E power lines sparked last year's massive wildfire, which exploded to become the second-largest in California history. California investigators have concluded that PG&E Corp. power lines ignited a wildfire in the Sierra Nevada foothills last summer that exploded to become the second-largest in state history.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Tencent Sells Roughly $3 Billion in Shares of Singapore's Sea
summary: Chinese internet giant retains 19% share of the e-commerce and videogame company, whose value has surged in recent years. Tencent Holdings Ltd. has cut its stake in a highly valued Southeast Asian internet company, shedding an ownership position that was worth about $3 billion.

title: Trump Cancels News Conference Planned for Anniversary of Jan. 6 Riot
summary: House committee probing U.S. Capitol attack seeks answers from Fox News host Sean Hannity. WASHINGTON-Former President Donald Trump canceled a planned news conference on Jan. 6 as the House select committee investigating the attack on the U.S. Capitol asked Fox News host Sean Hannity to voluntarily answer questions about his communications with the White House.

title: Buttigieg's FAA and 5G Mid-Air Collision
summary: Here's the political back story on the wireless-airline feud.. Biden Administration officials are crowing that they prevented a collision over 5G wireless spectrum between airlines and wireless carriers that had threatened to ground flights across America this week. But they created this problem, and the mess could endanger U.S. 5G leadership.

title: CES 2022: Five Tech Trends to Watch in an Unusual Year
summary: Omicron might prevent some big exhibitors from attending, but over 2,000 companies are expected in Las Vegas to unveil innovations. Nothing about this year's CES will be normal. That includes some of the biggest trends expected at the show.

title: U.S. Has Arrested Its First Suspect in Slaying of Haitian President
summary: Former Colombian soldier who had escaped after the assassination is flown to Miami on murder conspiracy charges after arrest in Panama. BOGOTA, Colombia-A former Colombian soldier who Haitian authorities said was involved in the July assassination of Haitian President Jovenel Moïse has become the first suspect in the case to be arrested by U.S. officials and brought before an American court.

title: Deere Rolls Out Fully Autonomous Tractor at CES
summary: Company plans to sell the neural network on wheels in 2022. Deere & Co. said Tuesday that it has developed a fully autonomous tractor designed for large-scale farming and that it plans to sell the machine later this year.

title: CDC Updates Isolation Guidance, Stops Short of Requiring Testing
summary: The agency has been criticized for its shortened recommended isolation period without asking people to get tested. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention on Tuesday updated its guidance for people infected with the virus that causes Covid-19, including new details for people who want to test before leaving isolation. But the agency stopped short of saying that people must get a test before going back to work or resuming social activities.

title: Manchin Deflates Democrats' Hopes of Changing Filibuster, Passing Election Bills
summary: West Virginia senator says changes to Senate procedures should include Republicans' support. WASHINGTON-Sen. Joe Manchin (D., W.Va.) cast doubt on a Democratic push to change Senate procedures to weaken the minority party's power, dealing a blow to party leaders' effort to change the filibuster and advance their elections bills.

title: Candle Media Buys Stake in Media Company Co-Founded by Will Smith and Jada Pinkett Smith
summary: Firm led by former Disney executives Kevin Mayer and Tom Staggs and backed by Blackstone is paying about $60 million for more than 10% of Westbrook. Candle Media, a firm led by two former Walt Disney Co. executives, has agreed to buy a stake in Will Smith and Jada Pinkett Smith's media company, the latest in a series of high-profile acquisitions for the Blackstone Inc. -backed entertainment venture.
